hello I'm Kevin a cloud sport engineer
based in the AWS office in Cape Town
today I'm going to show you how to
activate AWS identity and access
management authentication for access to
your Amazon API Gateway rest API let's
get
started the first step is to turn on IM
authentication on the API Gateway
console for this video I'll use used the
example pet store API log into the AWS
Management console and then navigate to
the API Gateway console in the left
navigation pane expand apis and then
select your rest API in the resources
pane select the method that you want to
turn on IM authentication for such as
get or post in the method execution pane
on the right choose method request under
method request settings choose
edit from the authorization drop down
list select AWS im as the authorization
type then choose
save repeat these steps for any other
methods that you want to secure with IM
authentication when we are done we must
deploy the API for the changes to take
effect in the left navigation pane
select resources and then choose deploy
API because this is the first time
deploying the API we must create a new
stage then choose
deploy note the invoke URL that shows
shows here in the stage editor will need
that URL for testing in The Next Step
let's go ahead and test the API using
the postman
client Bas the URL that doesn't have IM
authentication turned on in Postman then
make sure that the get method is
selected select send to send a request
to the API the status return is HTTP 200
this output means that the request was
successful now let's test API Gateway
method that has I'm authentication
turned on to verify that IM
authentication is turned on paste the
URL that has IM authentication turned on
in Postman and then make sure that the
correct path is added and the get method
is selected select send to send a
request to the API the status returned
is HTP 403 with a response that shows
missing authentication token this means
that the request must be signed with an
IM identity that has permissions to call
the API endpoint our next step is to
Grant a test user the permissions to
invoke the Amazon API Gateway rest API
endpoint let's return to the AWS
Management
console navigate to the IM console and
then select users in the left hand pane
under the users pane select create user
enter the username and then select next
under permission options select attach
policies directly then find and select
the following manage policy Amazon API
Gateway invoke full access select select
next and then select create
user now we must get the user access
keys that will be used in the AWS 64
signature in the IM console select the
user that you created
previously navigate to the security
credentials tab find the access key
section and select create access key
choose the other use case select next
and then select create access
key note the access key and secret
access key because we'll use these
values to sign the request to API
Gateway let's return to
postman paste the URL in Postman and
then make sure that the correct path is
added and the get method is selected in
the authorization tab select AWS
signature from the type drop- down list
fill in the following Fields the access
key with your AWS access key ID the
secret key with your AWS secret access
key the AWS region the region where your
API is deployed such as us east1 and the
service name which is execute
API select send to send the request to
the API the status returned is HTP 200
the status means that the request was
successful so now you know how to
activate IM authentication for access to
your Amazon API Gateway arrest
API thanks for watching and happy cloud
computing from all of us here at AWS
